verses.verse: Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.
After he fasting forty days and forty nights, by then he was hungry.
When the tempter came to him, he said, "If you are the Son of God, command that these stones become bread."
But he replied and said, "It has been written: Man will not live by bread only but by every word that comes out of the mouth of God."
Then the devil took him up into the holy city and set him on a pinnacle of the temple,

and said to him, "If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down, for it has been written: He will command his angels concerning you, and they will hold you up with their hands, lest at any time you whack your foot against a stone."
Jesus said to him, "Yet again it has been written: You will not tempt the Lord your God."

Again the devil took him up on a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their splendor, Mat 4:9 and said to him, "All these things I will give you, if you will kneel down and worship me."
Then Jesus said him, "Get out of here, Satan, for it has been written, "You will worship the Lord your God and serve only him."
Then the devils left him, and look! Angels came and ministered to him.
Now when Jesus had heard that John was thrown into prison, he left for Galilee.
Then leaving Nazareth, he came and lived in Capernaum, which is on the sea coast by the borders of Zebulun and Naphtali,
so that it might be fulfilled what was spoken by Isaiah the prophet saying,
"Land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, by the road to the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles,
the people sitting in darkness saw great light and to those sitting in the region and shadow of death, light is risen up."
From that time Jesus started to preach and say, "Repent, for the Kingdom of heaven is near at hand."
J, walking by the Sea of Galilee, saw two brothers, Simon named Peter and Andrew his brother, throwing a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.
He said to them, "Follow me, and I will make you fishermen of people."
Immediately they left their nets and followed him.
Leaving there he saw two others brothers, James, son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in a ship with Zebedee their father, mending their nets, and he called them
Immediately they left the ship and their father and followed him.
Jesus went around all of Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all kinds of sickness and types of disease among the people.

His fame went throughout all of Syria, too, and they brought to him all sick people who were afflicted with different diseases and severe pains, those who were possessed with devils, those who were mentally ill, and those who were paralyzed. He healed them all.
Great crowds of people followed him from Galilee, Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judah, and the other side of the Jordan.
